title: Four questions in the Micah Parsons trade aftermath: Why in the world would Dallas do this?
content: What are the Cowboys doing? Did they get enough in return? And does Parsons put the Packers at the top of the NFC? Let's sort through this wild trade.

title: A new look in Green Bay: Parsons trade continues Packers' aggressive offseason
content: Signs of change in Green Bay include paying up to trade for Parsons after finally taking a WR in the first round.

title: Parsons traded to Packers, gets record contract
content: Star pass rusher Micah Parsons was traded by the Cowboys to the Packers and agreed to a record contract for a non-quarterback with Green Bay.

title: Betting stampede on Longhorns shrinks OSU line
content: Ohio State opened as a 3-point favorite over Texas months ago, but sportsbooks have been reporting a steady stream of money on the Longhorns throughout the summer, causing the line to move.

title: Titans' Ridley: Ban made me 'mentally stronger'
content: As Titans wide receiver Calvin Ridley heads into Year 2 with the franchise, he's in a better headspace in his life after injuries and a mental health journey, which included a gambling suspension, derailed his career.

title: Dolphins OLB coach arrested on battery charge
content: Dolphins outside linebackers coach Ryan Crow has been placed on administrative leave after he was arrested on a domestic battery charge.

title: Jones: Parsons trade will make Cowboys better
content: Cowboys owner Jerry Jones said that trading Micah Parsons to the Packers for Kenny Clark and two draft picks will help Dallas have future playoff success.

title: 'Fun night': Schwarber has MLB's 21st 4-HR game
content: Philadelphia slugger Kyle Schwarber hit four home runs Thursday night against Atlanta to become the fourth Phillies player and 21st major leaguer to accomplish the feat.

title: Gauff fights tears, 8 double faults to grind out win
content: Coco Gauff was broken four times and had seven double faults in the first set but still managed to gut out a 7-6 (5), 6-2 victory over Donna Vekic in the second round of the US Open.

title: Report: Irsay suffered drug relapses before death
content: Former Colts owner Jim Irsay suffered setbacks from a longtime addiction to painkillers before his May death and overdosed at least three times since February 2020, according to The Washington Post.

title: üèà Fantasy football: Do Not Draft list
content: The annual hit is back, with players Eric Karabell feels are going earlier than they should in drafts this summer.

title: Debunking your favorite NFL officiating conspiracy theories
content: Are the refs penalizing some teams more than others? Which coaches win challenges? We crunched the numbers.

title: Coach Prime 2.0: What's next for Deion and the Buffaloes
content: Colorado's new era begins Friday. Deion Sanders says, "It's always going to be a challenge, I don't mind that."

title: 'Split' title 35 years ago? Don't tell Colorado and Georgia Tech that
content: The two teams are meeting in Week 1, 35 years after splitting the 1990 national title in controversial fashion.

title: Breaking down Texas-Ohio State, LSU-Clemson and 24 other matchups in an epic Week 1
content: College football is back in a big way, with Arch Manning taking on the defending champs, a showdown in Death Valley and more.

title: NBA predictions: 10 teams that could exceed, fall short of ESPN's forecast
content: Too low on OKC? Too high on the Spurs? Tim Bontemps breaks down ESPN's Summer Forecast win predictions.

title: To transfer or not to transfer? For USMNT players in a World Cup year, there's no perfect answer
content: The goal is clear: find your best form and make the 2026 World Cup roster. But USMNT hopefuls must decide whether a transfer is necessary to achieve it.

title: Why Man United's best player may be their biggest problem
content: As Manchester United's freefall continues, is captain and talisman Bruno Fernandes becoming more of a liability than an asset?

title: Let's predict the NFL draft: Kiper's 10 preseason takes, including why all eyes are on Penn State
content: Which school will have the most picks? How many QBs will go in Round 1? Who is a sleeper for WR1? Mel Kiper Jr. makes predictions for the 2026 NFL draft class.

title: Liz Loza's draft rules (there are none!), five players to pick and two to fade
content: It's finally time to make picks, so consider the trends surrounding these players as you prepare your draft board.

title: Mike Clay's Playbook, Part 3: How to manage your team post-draft
content: The draft is just the beginning of the fun. Mike Clay gives you a guide to being a savvy, championship-winning manager.

title: From Collier to Clark and more: How injury returns could impact the playoffs
content: Napheesa Collier and Breanna Stewart are back, with more injured stars eyeing returns before the postseason.

title: Lee Corso's impact felt far beyond 'GameDay' audience
content: The larger-than-life face of college football has touched so many, from fans and players to colleagues and friends.

title: Is the under the play to make in Texas-Ohio State?
content: The Buckeyes are slight favorites at home against the No. 1-ranked Longhorns. Here's how to bet the game.

title: Should you take LSU and the points at Clemson?
content: LSU heads to Clemson as underdog in one of the biggest matchups of Week 1. Here's how to bet the game.

title: Cincinnati's new script helmets headline best college football uniforms from Week 1
content: Cincinnati isn't the only team doing something new for Week 1 -- North Carolina State will be debuting its "City of Oaks" uniform.

title: Ben Shelton and Trinity Rodman relationship timeline
content: The NWSL player playfully challenged the tennis star with a question about his 2nd-round US Open performance.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Spurs eye Sancho to replace Son
content: Tottenham Hotspur are considering a move to sign Manchester United winger Jadon Sancho as a replacement for Son Heung-Min. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: The best NHL draft pick ever, at every slot from No. 1 to 224
content: Who's the best No. 1 pick? What about No. 27? We analyzed every draft from 1967 to 2025 to find the answers.

title: 'The Rich Eisen Show' on ESPN: How to listen and watch
content: 'The Rich Eisen Show' is joining forces with ESPN platforms! Find out how to get your weekday dose of pop culture and sports now.

title: 'Hate remarks': BJP slams Moitra's shocking comment on Shah; complaint filed
content: TMC MP Mahua Moitra ignited controversy with a remark targeting Amit Shah, allegedly stating his "head should be cut off" regarding illegal immigration. The BJP strongly condemned Moitra's statement as hateful, questioning if it reflected the TMC's stance. Moitra accused the Union government of border security negligence, referencing PM Modi's Independence Day speech on infiltrators.

title: 'Social Truth' vs data: What Trump doesn't get about India's 'dead' economy
content: India's GDP surged by 7.8% in the April-June quarter, exceeding expectations and marking the fastest growth in five quarters, driven by robust farm output, private spending, and a thriving services sector. Despite this strong performance, looming US tariffs threaten India's export engine and could potentially dampen future growth, impacting employment and private investment.

title: Trump wrecking America-India ties, admits US Congress report
content: Donald Trump has never disguised his transactional approach to foreign policy. But in 2025, his behaviour toward India has crossed into something far more disruptive. He has claimed credit for ending a May India-Pakistan conflict (a claim Delhi flatly rejects). He has invited Pakistan‚Äôs army chief to lunch at the White House, prompting anger in Delhi that Washington is ‚Äútreating India and Pakistan as equals.‚Äù And he has escalated a tariff war, leaving Indian exporters facing what the US Congressional Research Service (CRS) describes as a ‚Äú50% tariff on India on top of existing tariffs.‚Äù

title: Sikh man shot dead in LA: What prompted cops to take deadly action?
content: A LAPD police video revealed the fatal shooting of Gurpreet Singh, a 35-year-old Sikh man, after 911 calls reported him wielding a machete and threatening people. Singh, seen performing Gatka, charged at officers after a car chase, leading to the shooting. The incident is under investigation, with reviews to determine if the use of force was justified.

title: 'India ready': PM Modi explains why good ties with China are 'crucial'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi emphasized India's commitment to strengthening ties with China based on mutual respect and interest, ahead of his visit to Tianjin for the SCO Summit. He highlighted the potential for India-China relations to foster regional and global stability.

title: Intel-US deal: Chipmaker gets $5.7bn; CFO says it will 'save' company
content: The Trump administration strategically acquired a ten percent stake in Intel. This move aimed to stop Intel from selling its manufacturing unit. The US government converted 8.9 billion dollars in grants into equity. This made the government a major shareholder. A five-year warrant allows the government to acquire more shares if Intel's foundry ownership drops.

title: CWG 2030: India submits proposal; Ahmedabad put forward as the host
content: India bids to host the 2030 Commonwealth Games. Ahmedabad is proposed as the host city for the Centenary edition. The bid emphasizes 'Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam' and 'Atithi Devo Bhava'. PT Usha highlights India's sporting capabilities and values. The Games aim to inspire a new generation through sport. This aligns with India's vision to be a leading sporting nation.

title: India's GDP to grow by upto 6.8%; CEA says US tariff impact 'short-term'
content: Chief Economic Advisor anticipates India's economy to grow between 6.3% and 6.8% in FY26, dismissing concerns about high US tariffs causing significant risks. The economy expanded by 7.8% in April-June, driven by a robust farm sector, outpacing China's growth. Manufacturing activity remained steady, contributing to the overall positive economic outlook.

title: Dharmasthala case: Sujata wants to withdraw complaint during SIT interrogation
content: Sujata Bhat, who alleged her daughter disappeared from Dharmasthala temple in 2003, reportedly wants to withdraw her complaint. During SIT interrogation, her statements contradicted earlier claims, suggesting she was lying and obstructing justice. Despite her potential withdrawal, the SIT will likely continue investigating due to the serious allegations and ongoing judicial process.

title: Silicon Valley in grief: Microsoft techie found dead; what police said
content: Pratik Pandey, a 35-year-old Microsoft engineer, was discovered dead at the company's Silicon Valley campus on August 20, according to Bloomberg. Pandey, who often worked late, badged into the office the previous evening. While the cause of death is under investigation, authorities have found no signs of suspicious activity.

title: 6 pacts & 7 MoUs: What PM Modi achieved in Japan visit - key outcomes
content: India and Japan have launched an Economic Security Initiative, focusing on supply chain resilience and collaboration in sectors like semiconductors and clean energy. The countries are also strengthening ties through the Japan-India Artificial Intelligence Initiative, aiming to enhance cooperation in AI technologies. Both nations plan to increase people-to-people exchanges and foster business collaboration.

title: UP CM Yogi Adityanath says Sambhal report reveals how conspiracy unfolded
content: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath revealed a riot conspiracy in Sambhal, based on a judicial commission report. The report highlights a significant demographic shift, with the Hindu population declining drastically since Independence. Adityanath vowed to prevent further demographic changes and ensure equal benefits for all citizens, referencing past targeted actions against Hindus under previous administrations.

title: Record! India pacer Nabi clinches 5-wicket haul to achieve rare milestone
content: North Zone's pacers dominated the Duleep Trophy quarterfinal against East Zone. Auqib Nabi's hat-trick and five-wicket haul helped dismiss East Zone for 230, while Arshdeep Singh and Harshit Rana delivered impactful spells. North Zone extended their score to 405, establishing a 183-run lead. Arshdeep, returning from injury, showcased excellent form.

title: 'Not the smartest': Oracle founder's candid take on Bill Gates; likens him to Rockefeller
content: Larry Ellison lauded Bill Gates' relentless drive, comparing him to John D. Rockefeller. Despite acknowledging others might be smarter, Ellison emphasized Gates' unmatched focus and endurance. He highlighted Gates' pivotal role in Microsoft's success, noting his 'utterly relentless' nature. The Oracle founder's remarks underscore Gates' reputation as a powerhouse, capable of dominating through execution.

title: Bihar SIR: EC flags 'doubtful citizenship' of 3L voters; border districts in focus
content: In Bihar, nearly three lakh electors are under scrutiny due to "doubtful citizenship" during the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls. These flagged individuals are part of the 7.24 crore voters listed in the draft rolls, with suspicions arising from document discrepancies noted by Electoral Registration Officers. Most cases are reported from border and migrant-heavy districts.

title: Watch: Who is the funniest in Team India? Rohit Sharma discloses
content: Rohit Sharma fondly recalled Shikhar Dhawan's humor, highlighting his ability to lighten the mood in the Indian dressing room. Sharma expressed his desire to hit every bowler for a six, emphasizing his aggressive mindset. Despite retiring from T20Is and Tests, Rohit remains focused on ODIs, anticipating his return in the upcoming series against Australia.

title: Cody & Brandi Rhodes: Welcome second child before 12th anniversary
content: Cody Rhodes and Brandi Rhodes, a celebrated wrestling couple, recently welcomed their second daughter, Leilani Ella Runnels, on August 29, 2025. The couple, who are set to celebrate their 12th wedding anniversary in September, shared their joy on social media. Leilani joins their first daughter, Liberty, born in 2021, expanding the Rhodes family.

title: 'I want to quit': Man United boss Amorim amid calls for sacking
content: Manchester United's manager, Ruben Amorim, confessed to considering leaving after their shocking League Cup defeat to Grimsby Town. Amorim expressed frustration with his team's inconsistency, admitting he sometimes hates his players. Despite contemplating his position, he's now focused on the upcoming Premier League clash against Burnley and looks to correct things moving forward.

title: 'Will rid India of illegal foreigners': Amit Shah renews vow in Assam
content: Union home minister Amit Shah affirmed BJP's commitment to remove infiltrators from India, highlighting PM Modi's demography mission to identify them. Speaking in Guwahati, Shah praised Assam's efforts against illegal immigration, referencing Golap Borbora's voter list cleanup.

title: PM 'abused': After clash, war of words; BJP seeks apology, Cong makes big claim
content: A political controversy erupts. It involves Congress and BJP. Allegations of abuse target Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The incident occurred during a rally in Darbhanga. Amit Shah demands an apology from Rahul Gandhi. Rahul Gandhi speaks of truth prevailing. Congress claims BJP agents made the remarks. Clashes between party workers break out in Patna. Nitish Kumar condemns the language used.

title: World C'ships: No medal! Sindhu suffers major setback in QF
content: PV Sindhu's quest for a record sixth World Championships medal ended in a quarterfinal defeat against Indonesia's Putri Kusuma Wardani. Despite a strong second-game comeback, Sindhu faltered in the decider, allowing Wardani to secure the victory. Earlier, India's mixed doubles pair also exited, losing to Malaysian opponents Chen Tang Jie and Toh Ee Wei.

title: Tariff war enters campus: LPU bans American colas; a campus lesson beyond tokenism
content: Lovely Professional University (LPU) in Punjab has banned American soft drinks, including Coca-Cola and Pepsi, from its campus. Announced by Chancellor Ashok Kumar Mittal, the move responds to the US doubling tariffs on Indian goods to 50%. Framed as part of a modern ‚ÄòSwadeshi 2.0‚Äô campaign, the ban encourages students and citizens to prioritise Indian products, echoing the 1905 Swadeshi movement.

title: Trump cancels Harris' security; why Biden extended her protection
content: Donald Trump has reportedly cancelled the Secret Service protection extended to Kamala Harris by Joe Biden, exceeding the legally mandated six months post her vice presidency. Effective September 1, 2025, Harris will no longer receive Secret Service agents or threat intelligence, just before her national book tour promoting her memoir, "107 Days".

title: Arjun, Saaniya attend function; Sachin pens emotional note - 'A blessing'
content: Sachin Tendulkar celebrated his mother, Rajni Tendulkar's, birthday with a heartfelt Instagram post featuring intimate family pictures. The cricket legend expressed deep gratitude and admiration for his mother's strength and blessings in a touching caption. His emotional message and family snapshots resonated with fans across social media, highlighting the special bond he shares with his mother.

title: 10 must-see night sky events in September: Blood Moon, Jupiter-Moon pairing and more
content: September 2025 offers a celestial spectacle with a total lunar eclipse visible across Asia and Africa, along with rare planetary alignments featuring Saturn and Neptune. Stargazers can witness Venus occulted by the Moon and observe Saturn at opposition. The new moon on September 21 creates ideal conditions for viewing deep-sky objects like the Milky Way.

title: Gold prices soar Rs 2,100 to record high of Rs 1,03,670/10 gm; silver slips Rs 1,000
content: Gold prices in the national capital soared to a record high of Rs 1,03,670 per 10 grams, driven by persistent buying, a weaker rupee, and global uncertainties. Silver prices eased after reaching record highs, while international markets saw spot gold remain steady. Market participants are closely monitoring US-India trade tensions and the upcoming US PCE Price Index release.

title: Asia Cup: India beat China 4-3; Harmanpreet's hat-trick inspires narrow win
content: Harmanpreet Singh's penalty corner hat-trick propelled India to a thrilling 4-3 victory over China in their Asian Cup hockey opener in Rajgir. Despite China's early lead and a late comeback to level the scores, Harmanpreet's clinical drag flicks proved decisive. India secured a crucial win in Pool A, showcasing both their attacking prowess and defensive vulnerabilities.

title: 'Assam can't be led by people who visit Pak': Shah's veiled attack on Gogoi
content: Amit Shah launched the BJP's Assam assembly election campaign at the NDA Panchayat Pratinidhi Sammelan in Guwahati, expressing confidence in securing a third consecutive term. He emphasized the party's commitment to protecting Assamese identity by addressing infiltration and land encroachment. Shah criticized the Congress, accusing them of sympathizing with infiltrators and undermining Assam's cultural values.

title: Shubhman Gill to reach Bengaluru today, will train at CoE ahead of Asia Cup
content: Shubman Gill, recovering from a viral flu, is expected to arrive in Bengaluru to begin Asia Cup preparations at the BCCI Centre of Excellence. He will undergo assessment and training due to unsuitable facilities near his home, and is likely to depart for Dubai from Bengaluru, joining other squad members.

title: India's GDP grows at robust 7.8% in Q1 FY26; beats estimates by wide margin
content: India's GDP surged by 7.8% in the first quarter of FY 2025-26, exceeding expectations and surpassing the previous year's 6.5% growth. This robust performance is a welcome boost amidst concerns about potential impacts from newly imposed US tariffs. The agriculture and tertiary sectors showed significant improvements, while mining and quarrying experienced a decline.

title: John Harbaugh on Kyle Hamilton: Ravens safety signs $100M deal
content: Kyle Hamilton has become the NFL's highest-paid safety after signing a five-year, $100.5 million contract with the Baltimore Ravens. The deal, which includes $82 million guaranteed, reflects the team's confidence in Hamilton's talent and leadership. Coach John Harbaugh expressed his excitement, noting Hamilton's versatility and impact on the Ravens' defense.

title: British supercar maker with Lord Ganesha logo goes viral: Details
content: Lanzante Limited unveiled its first hypercar, the 95-59, at the Goodwood Festival of Speed 2025, blending heritage with performance. Designed by Paul Howse, it features a three-seat layout, an 850 hp twin-turbo V8, and a Ganesha-inspired crest. Limited to 59 units, the hypercar pays tribute to Lanzante's 1995 Le Mans victory.

title: 'Why scared?' Owaisi attacks PM over US tariffs; warns of impact on exporters
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government over the 50% tariff imposed by the US on Indian exports. Owaisi questioned Modi's silence and perceived fear of the US, particularly regarding statements made by US officials. He warned of significant losses, potentially around Rs 60,000 crore, for sectors like motor parts and garments.

title: Bihar SIR: Cong flags 'contradictions' in EC's replies; party makes 3 demands
content: The Congress party on Friday intensified its conflict with the Election Commission, alleging inconsistencies in the poll body's statements regarding the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) exercise in poll-bound Bihar. Citing RTI responses, Congress claims the EC lacks records of an 'independent appraisal' cited in court, questioning the transparency of the SIR decision.

title: Landslide zones rise sharply on Gangotri & Yamunotri highways
content: Persistent rains in Uttarakhand's Garhwal hills have escalated landslide risks on the Gangotri and Yamunotri highways, increasing danger zones from 16 to 23. New slide areas have emerged, threatening pilgrims and motorists. Authorities are prioritizing road repairs and protective measures, while bypass routes are proposed to safeguard the strategically important and tourism-dependent region.

title: LinkedIn survey: Trust in peers beats AI; upskilling pressure weighs on many
content: A recent LinkedIn survey reveals that professionals worldwide trust human connections over AI for advice and decision-making. The study, involving over 19,000 professionals, highlights that networks accelerate decision-making and boost confidence. Despite AI's growth, professionals value the nuanced judgment and empathy that human relationships provide, making them irreplaceable in the modern workplace.

title: Vishal and Sai Dhanshika engaged: Couple makes it official; 'feeling positive'
content: Vishal celebrated his 47th birthday with an engagement to actress Sai Dhanshika in a private ceremony at his Chennai home. The actor shared the news on X, accompanied by candid pictures, expressing gratitude for the birthday wishes and blessings. Their friendship of 15 years recently blossomed into love, prompting them to make their relationship official amidst persistent marriage rumors.

title: What is Daruma Doll gifted to PM Modi in Japan? Why it has no limbs, eyes
content: The chief priest of a Japanese temple gifted Daruma Doll to Prime Minister Narendra Modi as PM Modi reached Japan for his two-day visit. Daruma Doll is an iconic cultural symbol in Japan with its roots in India. Daruma is based on Bodhidharma, an Indian monk from Kancheepuram, known in Japan as Daruma Daishi.

title: World‚Äôs first pandemic mystery solved: Scientists uncover Yersinia pestis through ancient DNA
content: Scientists solve the mystery of the Justinian Plague. They identify Yersinia pestis as the cause. The plague devastated the Byzantine Empire. DNA from a mass grave in Jerash, Jordan confirms this. Jerash was a key trade hub. The study shows how pandemics reshape societies. Plague is a recurring threat. Understanding past outbreaks helps prepare for future ones. Vigilance is crucial.

title: Voter Adhikar Yatra: Sachin Pilot poses 3 questions to Centre
content: Sachin Pilot raised concerns about the Election Commission's integrity during the Voter Adhikar Yatra in Bihar. He questioned the removal of the CJI from the CEC selection process. Pilot also inquired about the destruction of CCTV footage. He highlighted the EC's initial refusal to provide voter lists. Clashes erupted in Patna between BJP and Congress workers.

title: Watch: Indian woman demands Rs 2,300 for wiping car window in UK
content: A video from Birmingham went viral showing an Indian student demanding ¬£20 from a car owner after wiping his window. The student insisted on payment, citing the cost of living, and blocked the car. The incident sparked online debate, with many users claiming it was staged for social media engagement, potentially damaging India's image.

title: Watch: Drunk man lying on road run over by SUV in Gurgaon, survives
content: In Gurgaon, a man lying inebriated on the road was shockingly run over by an SUV, an incident captured on camera. Miraculously, he sustained only minor injuries and sat up moments later. Despite the efforts of several passers-by to assist him, the unresponsive man remained on the road, unmoved from his position.

title: America‚Äôs 250th anniversary: UFC fight at White House officially happening
content: UFC CEO Dana White announced a historic UFC fight is officially set to take place at the White House on July 4, 2026, coinciding with the 250th anniversary of American independence. Following a successful meeting with former President Donald Trump, White confirmed the event, promising more details soon. Paramount+ is expected to play a big role in broadcasting the event.

title: Speaker Om Birla flags decline in standards of debate
content: At SC/ST welfare meet in Bhubaneswar, calls for equity-based nation ensuring rights of Dalits, tribals, marginalised sections

title: Land assignment rules an Onam gift for residents of Kerala‚Äôs hill districts, says Minister
content: The 1960 land assignment Act was amended and new rules made to solve the over six-decade-long land-related problems, particularly in Idukki. The rules, likely to be implemented by mid-Sept., give the govt. the power to grant permission for using land for purposes other than stated

title: RSS chief Bhagwat‚Äôs remarks on Mathura-Kashi are to shield BJP government from public anger: CPI(M)
content: CPI(M) Polit Bureau cites Bhagwat‚Äôs remarks that Muslims should ‚Äògive away‚Äô the mosques in these two places for ‚Äòbrotherhood‚Äô

title: Minister seeks to allay fears over constructions  in Idukki
content: New rules legalise construction violations until June 7, 2024.  However, it is silent on permission for new constructions and farmers‚Äô groups and the Idukki diocese of the Syro Malabar Church have raised concerns

title: Sharmila accuses TDP-JSP-BJP combine of crippling Vizag Steel Plant
content: APCC chief alleges workforce cuts and Centre‚Äôs ‚Äòbackdoor plan‚Äô are driving RINL into losses; slams State parties for remaining silent and backs reinvestigation into Vivekananda‚Äôs murder case

title: Minister inaugurates stadium renovated at ‚Çπ46 lakh at Puthenchira in Thrissur
content: Minister says government is moving towards its declared goal of setting up sports facilities in every grama panchayat

title: IT Minster Lokesh urges Chartered Accountants to become partners in development of Andhra Pradesh
content: Stating that the government has set a target of making Andhra Pradesh a $2.4 trillion economy by 2047, he invites the CAs to come up with ethical and effective policies, and be the guiding forces in the journey

title: Call letters despatched to 15,340 DSC-qualified candidates so far, says TDP leader
content: The NDA government has delivered its promise to fill teacher posts by successfully conducting Mega DSC in a transparent manner, says Pattabhi Ram

title: States should be compensated for revenue loss arising from GST rejig, says Kerala Finance Minister
content: Ministers from 8 non-BJP-ruled States meets in New Delhi ahead of the GST Council meet on September 3 and 4

title: CPI(M) accuses Congress of violating its own party constitution by not seeking Rahul Mamkootathil‚Äôs resignation as Palakkad MLA
content: A suspended Congress worker lost the right to represent the party in any official capacity, including as legislator or MP,¬†CPI(M) State secretary M.V. Govindan cites

title: Roadside rest centres part of waste-free Nava Kerala: Minister M.B. Rajesh
content: Minister highlights new waste management initiatives and stresses on public cooperation to keep roadside rest centres clean¬†

title: Madras High Court contemplates one-man Commission to probe alleged police excess while quelling conservancy workers protest
content: Justices M.S. Ramesh and V. Lakshminarayanan say, they may appoint a retired judge to conduct a thorough inquiry

title: Ice Age‚Äôs winged relic rediscovered in Western Ghats
content: Eusive dragonfly species Crocothemis erythraea spotted in the high-elevation regions of the southern Western Ghats

title: "Assam Cannot Be Led By People Who Visit Pakistan Frequently:" Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday said Assam cannot be led by people who make frequent visits to Pakistan, apparently referring to state Congress president Gaurav Gogoi's alleged links with the foreign nation.

title: Israeli Army Declares Gaza "A Dangerous Combat Zone"
content: The Israeli military declared Gaza City "a dangerous combat zone" on Friday, as it prepared to conquer the Palestinian territory's largest city after almost two years of devastating war.

title: Raghav Chadha Visits Flood-Hit Punjab District, Vows Funds Towards Relief Ops
content: Aam Aadmi Party MP Raghav Chadha visited Punjab's Gursdaspur and Dinanagar to assess the damage caused by flooding, which have left hundreds of people homeless and submerged vast swathes of residential areas and farmland.

title: Trump Administration Withdraws Kamala Harris's Secret Service Protection
content: The Trump administration has withdrawn former vice president Kamala Harris's Secret Service security protection, a White House official said Friday.

title: Airlines To Face Fresh Turbulence As Passenger Growth Slows, Costs Rise: Ratings Agency
content: India's aviation sector is bracing for a challenging year ahead, with credit rating agency ICRA (Investment Information and Credit Rating Agency) projecting the industry's net losses at Rs 9,500-10,500 crore in the current financial year.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Trump Is Indeed Making A Country Great Again. But It's China
content: US tariffs on other countries have helped China, and the measures will make these nations more dependent on Beijing. This dependency is likely to go beyond business and trade.

title: Video: Sikh Man Performing 'Gatka' On Road In Los Angeles Shot Dead By Police
content: A 36-year-old Sikh man, identified as Gurpreet Singh, was shot by the Los Angeles police in the middle of the road. According to the footage released by the police, Singh was performing Gatka, a form of traditional Sikh martial arts.

title: Explained: What Happens Next For Thailand After PM Sacked?
content: Thailand lost another prime minister to a court ruling on Friday, as Paetongtarn Shinawatra was thrown out of office over her handling of a border row with Cambodia.

title: Pawan Kalyan Visits Andhra's Rushikonda Hill, Inspects Controversial Structures
content: Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister and Janasena Party chief Pawan Kalyan today inspected the controversial structures on Rushikonda Hill, a site that has been at the centre of a major political and environmental debate.

title: YouTube Ordered To Grant Austria Users Access To Their Data
content: Austria's data protection authority said Friday that it has ordered YouTube to comply with EU regulations and respond to requests by users for access to data that it holds on them.

title: Sanskrit Teacher Sexually Assaults 7 Minor Odisha Girls In School
content: A school teacher sexually sexually harassed not one or two but seven minor girls in Odisha's Sundargarh district. The teacher fled the town after learning that the girls were proceeding with a police complaint.

title: Top Court To Hear Plea For Bihar Poll Revision Claim Deadline Extension On Monday
content: The Supreme Court will hear a plea on Monday seeking the extension of the deadline to submit claims by deleted voters from September 1 to 15.

title: Vietnam To Release Nearly 14,000 Prisoners On Its National Day
content: Vietnam will release nearly 14,000 prisoners, including foreigners, ahead of the country's national day celebrations.

title: Opinion: Opinion | BJP's 10 Big Strategies To Wrest Bengal From TMC This Time
content: Despite TMC's portrayal of corruption as a "washing machine issue" - that is, selective corruption - the BJP is working to put these issues in the spotlight.

title: Senior Beats Up Cop After His Dog Goes Missing In Madhya Pradesh
content: A bizarre incident in Madhya Pradesh has snowballed into a major controversy. On the night of August 23, constable Rahul Chauhan was allegedly beaten by Reserve Inspector (RI) Saurabh Singh Kushwaha after the officer's pet dog went missing.

title: "Against Party Line": BJP To MLA After Clash With Top District Official
content: Three days after sparking outrage by nearly assaulting Madhya Pradesh's Bhind Collector Sanjeev Srivastava, BJP MLA Narendra Singh Kushwaha was summoned to Bhopal and sternly reprimanded by the party leadership.

title: Class 9 Student Gives Birth In School Toilet In Karnataka
content: A 17-year-old class 9 student of a government-run residential school gave birth to a baby boy in the school's toilet, police said on Friday.

title: Complaint Against Trinamool's Mahua Moitra Over Amit Shah Remark
content: TMC MP Mahua Moitra has triggered a fresh political controversy with her remarks against Union Home Minister Amit Shah, accusing him of failing to check infiltration from Bangladesh and allegedly stating his "head should be cut off".

title: "Does Centre Want Border Wall Like US?" Top Court On Illegal Immigrants
content: The Supreme Court on Friday asked the Centre whether it wanted to build a border wall like in the US to prevent illegal immigrants from entering the country.

title: 50% Tariffs On India As Trump Could Not Mediate India-Pakistan Conflict: Jefferies Bank
content: The reason the United States slapped steep 50 per cent tariffs on India is because President Donald Trump was not allowed to mediate in the India-Pakistan conflict, according to a report by American multinational investment bank Jefferies.

title: It is a battle to safeguard our syncretic culture: Left parties on Vice Presidential election
content: Five Left parties endorse Opposition candidate Justice Sudershan Reddy, call contest one between two visions of India

title: Enrolment in government polytechnic colleges sees steady decline in State
content: There are a total of 109 government-run polytechnic colleges across the State, with a total of 26,730 diploma course seats available for the year 2025-26. As of July 31, with admissions for the courses having closed, only 17,381 seats had been filled, including 12,362 boys and 5,019 girls

title: Afghan national with Aadhaar card or an Indian: A curious case before Madras High Court
content: Justices M.S. Ramesh and V. Lakshminarayanan decide to await the decision to be taken by the foreigners tribunal in Assam regarding his nationality

title: Wildlife expert flags flaws in Kerala‚Äôs human-wildlife conflict policy draft
content: He recommends delinking SARPA from human-wildlife conflict programme, and urges government to extend assistance to snakebite victims through alternative schemes

title: BRS urges Speaker to give party ample opportunity to present its version on Kaleshwaram in Assembly

title: Drop move to hike GST on lottery, says Kerala
content: Finance Minister K.N. Balagopal says move to hike GST on lottery tickets from 28% to 40% will have serious consequences for over two lakh lottery agents, vendors and their families. The Kerala Lottery Protection Committee submits memorandum to Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman against the move

title: Kudumbashree flowers, produce ready for Onam

title: NEP‚Äôs vision transformative, higher education will play central role in developed India dream: Governor

title: Tunnel road to change economic and social landscape of Malabar
content: It will not only herald a fundamental shift in road connectivity between Kozhikode and Wayanad but also expected to boost farm and tourism sectors. It will be a faster, safer, and reliable compared to Thamarassery Ghat Road

title: Achievements of Surpur kings are bigger than the area they ruled, says Baraguru

title: Fire and SDRF teams rescue over 1,600 people from flood-hit districts

title: Young Eze's desire to improve led him back to Arsenal

title: Hamilton 'ready' for F1 restart
content: the 40-year-old says he will "hopefully" return for the first race back after the sport's summer shutdown . he is 42 points behind leclerc in the world championship, has been out-qualified by his teammate 10 times so far . his team principal Fred Vasseur said: "we're back on track after the summer break"

title: Where will your team's next ballpark be? What Royals can teach us about the future of MLB stadiums
content: The K is located in the Truman Sports Complex, next to Arrowhead Stadium . your feelings about that location might depend on how you view the relationship between baseball and the cities in which it is played . in 2021, so long ago that Bobby Witt Jr. had not yet debuted in the majors, Royals owner John Sherman announced a search for a new venue .

title: News: Red Sox, Mets promote pitching prospects

title: The game is on the line: Which WNBA player gets the last shot?

title: MLB Power Rankings: Where every team stands as final month approaches
content: alden Gonzalez and Jesse Rogers weigh in on who they like most to come out on top of the American League wild-card race . teams are mostly split into three categories: those preparing for the playoffs, those trying to make a run at contention and those whose focus has turned to next season . there's still a fair amount to play for within those groups .
